            FOR THE POOR

abstracts.cdata!:
The Health Insurance for the Poor
            Project for Argentina was approved by the Board of Directors
            on November 24, 1999. The loan was withdrawn as of November
            11, 2001. this note reflects the fact that the withdrawal of
            the loan took place before meaningful project
            implementation. The main objective of the project was to
            pilot the development of health insurance for the poor in
            selected provinces by assisting the Government in developing
            the legal, institutional and financial framework to
            establish the proposed health insurance scheme which could
            eventually have been replicated throughout the country. In
            May 24, 2001, when the first deadline to sign the Loan
            Agreement lapsed, the Government requested a three months
            extension of the signing date, the Bank accepted and
            extended the signing date to August 28, 2001. During the
            three months extension the authorities of the Ministry of
            Health took the necessary internal actions to review and
            agree on the content of the Presidential Decree needed to
            approved the terms of the Loan Agreement and proceeded with
            the signing of the document. However, due to the delay in
            issuing such Presidential Decree before August 28, 2001, the
            Loan Agreement failed to be signed within the maximum period
            established by the Bank's policies of 18 months after
            the Board Approval. Consequently, the Bank's management
            decided to withdraw the Loan as of November 11, 2001.
